question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Module: bulletproofs] [Range proof forgery] The bulletproofs module is exposed - can malicious actors forge range proofs that appear valid but actually hide values outside the claimed range, potentially enabling inflation attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Module: bulletproofs] [Verification performance] Does the bulletproofs verification have proper resource limits, or could an attacker submit proofs with excessive complexity causing DoS through verification slowdown? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Module: x25519] [Small subgroup] The x25519 module is exported for key exchange - does it properly clear cofactor to prevent small subgroup confinement attacks that could weaken shared secrets? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Module: x25519] [Key validation] Does the x25519 implementation validate that received public keys are valid curve points before computing shared secrets, preventing invalid curve attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Module: poseidon_bn254] [ZK hash collision] The poseidon_bn254 module exposes ZK-friendly hashing - are the Poseidon parameters properly chosen to prevent collision attacks that could forge ZK proofs? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Module: poseidon_bn254] [Field overflow] Does the Poseidon BN254 implementation properly handle field arithmetic without overflow/underflow that could lead to incorrect hash outputs enabling proof forgery? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Module: arkworks] [Serialization] The arkworks module likely provides elliptic curve operations - does the serialization of curve points properly validate canonical encoding to prevent point malleability? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Module: arkworks] [Polynomial evaluation] If arkworks includes polynomial operations for ZK proofs, are there timing side-channels in polynomial evaluation that could leak secret witness values? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Module: blstrs] [BLS implementation choice] The crate exposes both bls12381 and blstrs modules - could confusion between these two BLS implementations lead to using incompatible signature formats causing signature verification failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Module: blstrs] [FFT vulnerabilities] The blstrs module likely includes FFT operations for polynomial commitments - are there integer overflow vulnerabilities in FFT that could corrupt cryptographic computations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Module: elgamal] [Chosen ciphertext] The elgamal module is exposed - does the ElGamal encryption implementation provide CCA2 security, or is it vulnerable to chosen-ciphertext attacks enabling plaintext recovery? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Module: elgamal] [Randomness reuse] Does the ElGamal implementation prevent randomness reuse across encryptions, or could repeated randomness enable attackers to decrypt messages? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Module: asymmetric_encryption] [Padding oracle] The asymmetric_encryption module is exported - does it properly implement padding (e.g., OAEP) to prevent padding oracle attacks that could enable full plaintext decryption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Re-export: traits] [Trait implementation] The traits module is re-exported with 'pub use self::traits::*' - could incorrect trait implementations in consuming code lead to cryptographic misuse, such as custom serialization breaking signature verification? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Re-export: once_cell] [Hidden dependency] The once_cell crate is re-exported as #[doc(hidden)] - is this used for lazy static initialization of cryptographic constants, and could race conditions in initialization lead to use of uninitialized crypto state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Re-export: serde_name] [Serialization confusion] The serde_name crate is re-exported as #[doc(hidden)] for CryptoHasher derive - could malicious serde rename attributes cause hash domain confusion enabling collision attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Module interaction] [Algorithm confusion] With multiple signature schemes (ed25519, bls12381, secp256k1, secp256r1) exported, could attackers exploit algorithm confusion attacks where a signature from one scheme is validated against a public key of another scheme? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Module interaction] [Key type confusion] Do all exported cryptographic modules properly type-tag their keys and signatures to prevent key-type confusion attacks where ED25519 keys are misused as BLS keys or vice versa? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Module interaction] [Hash function mismatch] With both the hash module and poseidon_bn254 module exposed, could inconsistent hash function usage across modules lead to Merkle tree construction/verification mismatches? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Public API] [Deprecation safety] Are deprecated cryptographic primitives properly removed from the public API, or do old deprecated exports remain accessible enabling use of broken cryptography? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Public API] [Test utilities leak] The test_utils module is publicly exported - does this expose test-only cryptographic utilities (like deterministic key generation) that should never be used in production, creating security risks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Public API] [Error information leak] Do the exported error types from the error module leak sensitive cryptographic operation details that could assist attackers in side-channel or fault injection attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Module structure] [Version confusion] Does the crate properly version its cryptographic API, or could breaking changes in cryptographic implementations cause consensus failures when validators run different versions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Module structure] [Feature flag security] Are cryptographic implementations properly gated behind feature flags, or could accidentally enabling experimental cryptography in production cause security vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/lib.rs] [Dependency management] [Supply chain] With multiple cryptographic modules depending on external crates (blst, arkworks, etc.), are there proper supply chain security checks to prevent malicious dependency injection compromising cryptography? (Critical)
